clinical_study.brief_title: Preparing for Kidney Transplant by Attaining a Healthy Weight
clinical_study.official_title: Preparing for Kidney Transplant by Attaining a Healthy Weight

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine if an assigned physical fitness program will result in weight loss to prepare patients for kidney transplant.

detailed_description.textblock: The goal of this study is to prepare subjects for kidney transplant. Patients who are in need of a kidney transplant but are unable to be place on the wait list due to weight will be enrolled in a six month workout program. The workout program will consist of counseling from a registered dietician, personal training from certified trainers and constant health monitoring.

primary_outcome.description: The difference in starting weight and ending weight six months after beginning exercise program will be measured.

arm_group.description: Subjects receive a diet plan and exercise regimen.

intervention.description: Each subject will receive a personalized diet plan from nutritionist.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult patients over 18 years of age and older but less than 65
- All patients who are currently listed as "inactive" on the University of Chicago kidney transplant wait list
- Those with a body mass index of 40-44
- Those with access to the Internet
- Have transportation to the fitness center (Formula Fitness Center at Union Station location)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Those patients who are listed "inactive" on the wait-list due to co-morbid conditions other than obesity
- Those who are unwilling to attend fitness center appointments
- Those who do not have adequate transportation to the fitness center
- Those who do not have access to the Internet
- Those who are not comfortable navigating and using the Internet
